meanings.definition: The study of people's efficiency in their working environment.
meanings.sent1: Understanding ergonomics helps companies improve how well employees work in their office.
meanings.sent2: Ergonomics is important for making sure people can work comfortably and effectively.
meanings.sent3: The funny thing about ergonomics is that it's like finding the perfect puzzle piece for your job.
meanings.sent4: In a world of ergonomics, every desk and chair is a tailored suit for your productivity.
meanings.sent5: Ergonomics is the secret ingredient that makes work feel like a breeze.

meanings.definition: The design of equipment and devices to fit the human body's natural movements.
meanings.sent1: The new chair was created with ergonomics in mind to support the back and neck.
meanings.sent2: Good ergonomics in a keyboard means it won't strain your wrists during use.
meanings.sent3: When the robot tried to mimic human ergonomics, it ended up doing the robot dance.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were so fluid, it was as if she had mastered the art of ergonomic motion.
meanings.sent5: The ergonomic design of the car's steering wheel made long drives more comfortable.

meanings.definition: The science of creating products and environments that are user-friendly and efficient.
meanings.sent1: Ergonomics plays a key role in making sure technology is easy for everyone to use.
meanings.sent2: Companies invest in ergonomics to make their products more appealing to customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat door was a hilarious example of ergonomics gone wrong, as only the cat could fit through.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, ergonomics is the magic wand that turns complexity into simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The ergonomic layout of the store made shopping a breeze for all customers.
